Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Twelve -- $45.00 Service Charge - PJ - 9 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Twelve Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Twelve of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $45.00, plus a collection charge of $2.25 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of nine (9) years, beginning with the year 2020, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge representing a total increase of $10.50 over the prior service and collection charges that expired in 2018, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $1,980.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Twenty-Two -- $25.00 Service Charge - PJ - 9 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Twenty-Two Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Twenty-Two of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $25.00, plus a collection charge of $1.25 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of nine (9) years, beginning with the year 2020, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge in the same amount as the prior service charge that expired in 2018, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $11,175.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Two -- $50.00 Service Charge - PJ - 9 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Forty-Two Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Two of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $50.00, plus a collection charge of $2.50 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of nine (9) years, beginning with the year 2020, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge representing a total decrease of $26.25 less than the prior service and collection charges that expired in 2018, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $7,350.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Fifty-One -- $25.00 Service Charge - PJ - 9 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Fifty-One Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Fifty-One of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $25.00, plus a collection charge of $1.25 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of nine (9) years, beginning with the year 2020, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $25,000.00?
